text: Budget roofing done my roof in 2016 . They done a good job and nice price. They are now my go to people for roofs , vinyl siding, facial boards or anything dealing with a house. Give them a call and u want be disappointed.

name: Megan Carter
text: Would absolutely NEVER recommend this company. Our roof has been leaking every time it rains for a year after they supposedly fixed the problem a year and a half ago. They have made appointments and they have been a no show 5 times. 5! They finally came last week and supposedly fixed the problem. We made it through one rain storm before it started leaking again. They, of course, were a no show, again, after that when they were supposed to come reevaluate. Frustrated is an understatement.

name: Carol Ellison
text: Amazing roof,respectful team,on time,great price and would recommend to all😁🤗

name: Felisha Wynn
text: They did an excellent job on the roof but the clean up was non existent. Roofing nails were all over my property. My son stepped on one and I found one in my flat tire. I'm afraid that my Grandbaby might step on one after swimming in the pool. I called them to come back and clean up. I'm still waiting!

name: Amanda Hutchens
text: Budget Roofing saved my butt. I had severe damage after some storms, I could see the sky from my couch. I called after hours and the owner came out after 8pm (during the storm) and dried in my roof until the rain stopped. The very next day he quoted me a very fair price and had a crew there that day. They finished and you could never tell any damage was done, and on top of that, the owner was a great guy and worked with me the best he could on the pricing. All businesses get busy during storms and may miss a call or have to deal with customers that are not happy with anything, but I do have to say I feel they went above and beyond for me. I will call them with any further work I need done on my roof!!! Thanks Budget Roofing.

name: Heather Marie
text: We have called them every day about repairs that were already scheduled to be completed. They will schedule, not show up and then ignore phone calls for days. Very unprofessional and not reliable. Don't waste your money or time. It may be the cheapest quote but you will get cheap work and workers that do not show.

name: David Neely
text: I had alot of hail damage and several leaks and they came and replaced my roof and solved my problems. They did a great job at a great price and wouldn't use anyone else for my roofing needs!I will definitely refer them to anyone I know!Thanks Randall Whitt and Budget Roofing!

name: S
text: Budget Roofing, called me back, showed up and gave me a quote within a few hours, and had the work done in less than 24 hours (on a weekend no less). Pricing was good. Budget Roofing is a contractor that does what they say, does it on time, and does it on budget! I would totally recommend them for roofing work.

name: Wayne Nechy
text: I called Bugdet Roofing after the storms on April 3. My grandmother had 3 holes on our roof with water coming in, tbrough my drywall cieling. i am disabled as she is elderly and live alone. I called Budget Roofing, the owner himself came out , Mr. Randel Whitt. He had a generator and hit my power going so all my food didnt spoil. he then went on the roof and  stopped  the holes,  covered and stopped the leaks. the next day he had a crew out there and had all the problems fixed completley. i haven't had a problem since. He came back to check on me a few days later, very nice man. i would highly recommend this company to anyone who needs anything done as far as roofing and repairs.

name: Jane Dough
text: Really nice people ,they've done 2 roofs for me no problems what so ever,and great prices

name: Jeff Knight
text: Did a great job fixing with other contractor had messed up.  Great price and Great work!

name: kenneth Oliver
text: I was refered to budget roofing and at the moment my roof is leaking and with the storms on there way he came and covered the spot for FREE!! And a Free quote tomorrow. They got my business!

name: Kristin Posey
text: We tried for days to get in touch with them. After three days, they finally called us back and set up a time for a roofer to come out and give us an estimate. No one ever showed up and no one answered. I am flabbergasted by the fact that anyone runs their business this way. If this is how they handle this side of their business, I can only image how the roofing side is handled.

name: Audie Craig
text: Signed a contract and then never showed up!! Voicemail is full so you can’t leave a message. Had to track down another company!!!

name: JOE ROBERTS
text: Terrible!!!  Could not fix leak, roof rotted.  Had to hire another roofer to replace rotten roof plywood and shingles. Worst contractor that I have ever used.  Budget installed the roof originally.

name: Mr. John Howard
text: Honest dependable hard working folks!!

name: Greg Robinson
text:
I worked with Cole Jones in getting a quote for our roof.  Cole was responsive, on time, and thorough with his appointment, inspection and sitting down with us about the condition of the roof and options for a roof replacement.

Sandy followed up with scheduling the roof replacement and all the paperwork which was in fantastic order.

Blair showed up on the job, arranged for good weather (just kidding) and did what they said they would do when they said they would do.

The knowledge, expertise and quality was evident at the end and we are very satisfied with our roof.  It has been four months and not a single leak and they also replaced our gutters.

It was a pleasure working with them.

name: Ian Thomas
text:
We had a great experience with Blair. I did my homework and got quotes from 5 other companies, but Blair blew us away with their authenticity, local roots and competitive pricing. After getting a lot of quotes, it was clear that at our price point, all the windows were essentially the same quality with the same bells and whistles; it was the install that would really make or break the project.

I was confident that our windows would be installed correctly and if any issues were to come up, that Blair would resolve them. The install went smoothly, a little over a month after buying. We had metal windows and the guys took the time to cut them out by hand and ensure our new windows went in seamlessly. Instead of just throwing up wood surrounds, they capped the windows with custom aluminum before sealing it all up.

From beginning to end, Craig Blair was very patient in walking through everything with us and ensuring we were informed and comfortable. I feel very confident in being able to receive service if anything goes wrong in the future. I highly recommend Blair.

resp.text: Thanks Ian. Our pleasure.

name: J Baker
text: I contacted Blair Exteriors to replace the roof on my home.  I was terribly disappointed.  They almost destroyed our beautiful scrubs, which had been growing for 15 years, by throwing the old shingles off the roof onto our scrubs.  It will take years to get them back to form.  Instead of having brackets for their ladders they placed their ladders against our gutters scrapping the paint and bending the gutters.  On top of that I noticed the workers standing on the gutters.  I reported this to Dan Aycock, the Blair representative, and when he finally came by the house all he talked about was how he was going to do something about this in the future.  They had the highest quote, but I wanted to support a local business and felt I would get a better job.  I hate that I am writing this, but others should be aware.  J K Baker

resp.text: Hey Mr Baker, I spoke with Dan and the installation crew about the issues you experienced. I want to first thank you for your business and apologize for the issues. This is not the experience we want to leave any customer  with. I believe our office staff has already reached out to you but if you need anything please reach back out to us. Reviews like this help us see where to improve. Thanks

name: Kelly Horwitz
text: In an age when everyone seems to have a bad story about finding a contractor, Blair Exteriors is a breath of fresh air.  We needed a new roof - a project I was dreading. Blair made it easy and efficient. They are the consummate professionals. They arrived on time and worked until the sun set to get our roof on in a single day. Then they returned the next day to make sure everything was fully cleaned up. Make them your first call when you need work done on your house!

name: Brandon Thompson
text: Blair replaced my roof last year and had an issue a year later that was not their fault but they were quick to help get it resolved. Great company and great staff. Russel was very helpful.

name: Hillary Cherry
text:
The salesperson contacted me and set up my appointment.  When he called the day of my appointment he stated he lived in Hueytown and did not want to travel an hour across town nor he did he want to drive an hour an half back home.  He then gave me an out of this world number and when I told him we received quotes much lower he said go with them.  How rude! For a company to have 4.8 stars out of 5 one would expect better customer service.

11/1/19:  I am upgrading my review to 3 stars.  I was contacted by the Director of Marketing at Blair Exteriors and he was very apologetic about my situation.  My husband and I would like to personally thank you and your team for reaching out to us and taking care of this situation.  This shows your commitment to providing excellent customer service.  We will definitely reconsider using your services in the future.  Again, thank you.

resp.text: We would be happy to work with you on a future project. Thank you for taking our call and letting us make it right!

name: David Counts
text:
Sales:  Jay was most informative.  Shared many options with us and respected our budget limitations.  He was never "pushy". Was able to find some affordable customization opportunities for us also.  He kept in touch throughout the process, not just after the sale was made.

Financing:  Jay also shared some financing options that were most helpuf.

Products;  We purchased new windows, siding for the entire home, gutters, and chimney caps. Everything looks great.  With the new windows and the additional insulation wrap that come with the siding, our electric bill has already shown an improvement (even with all the 90+ days we have had).

Workcrews:  Russell, the project manager kept us up to date for the times the different crews (one for the windows and siding, one for the gutters, and one for the chimney caps) would come by and kept us up-to-date with the progress of each crew.  The work was accomplished much faster than we anticipated.  The crews were professional,well versed in their craft, unfailingly polite, and were very careful to check with us for anything out of the ordinary before proceeding.  They answered any questions that we had and they were also very careful with their clean up everyday.

Bottom Line:  I would recommend Blair and commend them for their excellent service.

name: Nancy Prater
text: Love my beautiful new roof!  All my neighbors are talking about the efficiency of the crew.  They can't believe it was a one day project.  Everyone arrived on time and worked safely. Excellent support staff in the office setting up the installation date and selecting the matching shingles!

resp.text: Thank you! We have some of the best crews! Your roof looks amazing!

name: Brandon Parker
text: We were really pleased with the quality and professionalism of Blair Exteriors. Our roof looks really great and the crew was very polite. Thanks for doing such a stand up job!

resp.text: We strive to provide every customer with exceptional customer service.

name: Sarah Shelton
text: I have used Blair Remodeling for three projects. I have used them to remodel a shower, seal the shingles on my house and to finish an existing shed. The work looks incredible. The best part about this company was that when we gave them a budget they were able to come up with a way to do the work within budget. We will hire Blair for any future projects we have. We would highly recommend this company to anyone.

name: David Shepherd
text: We chose Blair to replace 29 wood windows with very nice modern vinyl windows - low e gas, double hung, reflective coating, etc. The sales team was patient, knowledgeable, respectful, and above all honest. The pricing was a very fair value for what we purchased. The installers were great to work with. Courteous, professional, & thorough. They took their time to do it right the first time and were focused on the job before them NOT trying to get to the next job! The exterior trim work was exceptional. Everything the salesman told me would be done was completed by the installers without me having to bird dog them to do it. Very happy we chose Blair.

resp.text: We are thrilled that you are excited about how your window project turned out! Thank you for sharing your experience.

name: Elizabeth Williams
text: Blair Remodeling did a great job restoring my house. My house was built in 1952 so it was very important to me to preserve the old world charm of the house. Blair Remodeling replaced wood siding with James Hardie plank siding. They were able to match and install new windows that are identical to those that were original to the house. They also replaced the roof. All of this was done without jeopardizing the character of the house and preserving the integrity of the structure. I will definitely use them again for future remodeling projects.

name: Brandon Quick
text: Blair put on a new roof on our house after we discovered hail damage.  They were a pleasure to work with through the entire process.  They helped us pick out a new color and helped us decide on the GAF golden pledge warranty.  The roof installation crew took time to answer my questions and did a great job.  They were courteous and cleaned up after themselves.   The new roof looks great and I am glad I went with the color change.  They were a little slow getting to my last post installation punch list item but my overall experience with Blair was positive and they did what they said they would do and did a top quality job.  I would use them again and highly recommend them.

resp.text: We are delighted that you had a great experience!

name: TriceUA
text: I had previously wrote a review stating issues I had with the windows I had purchased from Blair due to leaking problems and would like to revise my previous review. The leak issue was finally fixed from another contractor and the windows that Blair installed for me were never the issue. They actually remained in excellent condition! My contractor said it was amazing that the windows weren't damaged at all because of the leak; which was due to poor trim and frame installation of Signature Homes. The quality and craftmanship of Blair Windows is top notch and I recommend them to anyone!

resp.text: I want to thank you for the newest review of Blair. We will always be there to help our customers. Thank you for being a Blair customer.

name: Randy Moon
text: Superior sales staff. Excellent installers. Wonderful office staff. You will not regret working with these people.

resp.text: Thanks Randy! I hope you enjoy your new deck with family and friends.

name: Casey OQuinn
text: Can't say enough about the team at Blair.  They are without a doubt the most professional craftsmen around.  From start to finish the job was extremely smooth.  They show up when they say they will and the new windows we had installed are worth every penny and look fantastic.  Extremely happy with the results and I highly recommend Billy and his team!!

name: James Wilson
text:
Blair Remodeling replaced 26 of my old wooden double hung windows with Wincore vinyl windows.  I first met with Craig Blair on April.  He gave me a quote that same day.  He was very patient and was definitely not in a hurry to leave, even though it was late in the day.  He answered all of my questions.  After I thought about it for a while he came back another afternoon to answer more questions and show the demo window unit to my wife.  Again, very patient and in no hurry to be anywhere.

Made down payment in April.  He said they would install in early June.  That is exactly what happened.  The install took only three days.  They started on a Wednesday and finished on a Friday.  The install crew consisted of three guys.  They were extremely polite and cleaned up their mess each day.

There was only one major issue.  There were streaks and smudges on every window.  It looked like some kind of sealant that was not cleaned off during the manufacturing process.  I met with the lead installer on Friday morning and pointed this out to him and asked that he clean the windows.  He was very condescending and obviously did not want to clean the windows.  He said he would but I knew he would not.  I went back to work (my wife was home but said she would not enforce the window cleaning)

The project was finished when I got home Friday afternoon.  The windows looked great but . . . You guessed it.  There were still streaks and smudges on all the windows.  Not wanting to be a pain, I tried cleaning the windows myself.  The sealant was very difficult to remove.  It would not come off with glass cleaner alone.  I decided this should definitely be Blair’s responsibility.

I asked for a meeting with Criag Blair.  We met the following week.  He was very polite and patient.  He agreed to have the windows cleaned and address a few other minor issues.

It took a while, and to be fair, I was out of town for a week but we finally coordinated on having the windows cleaned.  The crew that did the installation came back out.  They came while I was at work.  My wife was home but declined to be the inspector.  They finished cleaning about 3 PM.  They waited for me to get home at 4:30.  We walked around and inspected all 26 windows.  There were a few touch ups but for the most part they did a good job.

In summary, I was very pleased and satisfied with the entire process.  I will definitely use Blair Remodeling in for any future projects.  Craig Blair is the best.  I totally trust him and I know that he will do whatever is necessary to make sure I am satisfied.  Hopefully, Blair will add cleaning the windows to their standard installation procedure.

resp.text: Thanks James!

name: Ed Guui
text: Blair Remodeling did an excellent job replacing the roof on one of my commercial properties. The job was very professionally done in a speedy manner.  The crew cleaned up the area as if they were never there.  The contract explicitly stated some shrubs or plants may be damaged due to the nature of the work. The building is surrounded with ornamental shrubs and trees. They took extra care to make sure nothing was damaged.  The job, the quality of the material, the speed the work was completed and the value for my money makes me happy to recommend Blair Remodeling. In fact, shortly after my job was completed, I had the opportunity to suggest to a friend to work with them on his remodeling project. He picked them and I followed up with him a couple weeks later to find he too had the same outstanding results.  I highly recommend Blair Remolding.

name: Vicki Ricketts
text: Have used Blair Exterior for years and have never been disappointed. A solid company with quality workmanship.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to let us know how we did!

name: Steve Smith
text: We had 10 window replacements installed by Blair. The salesman that came was knowledgeable and courteous with our time, We will use them again.

resp.text: It was great working with you Steve!

name: Stephen Savincki
text: The work was top notch..... they were quick to respond to questions/concerns and treated us as if we were their only client! You will not go wrong using Blair I promise you!

name: Daniel Ferry
text:
We used Blair Remodeling to replace our roof. Their team was extremely knowledgeable about construction and roofing. They walked us through all of our options, and didn't pressure us. Their crew was professional , hard-working, and respectful of our home. They kept the work site (our yard) clean, and finished the project on schedule. We were so pleased with their work that we had them extend the roof over our patio and screen it in- not a an easy job on our house. They did beautiful work.

He definitely knows what he is doing and made everything super easy for us. We are super satisfied with the office and the field staff. Four-five days later I write and ask "where you at?" so he says that he had "other appointments to take care of after I cancelled."  I CANCELLED??  It RAINED.  Ok, says he's coming out again... 10 AM.  At 4:30 he finally gets around to emailing me and says that he's "running behind" and not going to make it.  So giving the benefit of the doubt I allow him to reschedule yet AGAIN for Monday 3/12, again at 10 AM.  No show, no email, no call.  I don't care if he would do the job for $1,000 less than anyone else, I'd never use Blair for anything including roofing my dog kennel.

Don't advertise gutter repair/replacement if you dont actually do the work!

They replaced some soffits, fascia and gutters after tree fell and damaged house. i was quite pleased with their work and their price. Their workers were courteous and knowledgeable of what they were doing. They got in and made  repairs quickly.  They are in demand so you may need to wait a week or two until they can get to you, but for the quality and price it is worth being a little patient. I will definitely call them again should the need arise. I do recommend them if you need their services.

I had Isbell Insulation come out again this week and add a board and batten siding product to part of the front of my house. Frank and Jeff came in the morning and work was completed by lunch time. I could have not been more pleased with their quality of work and professionalism. These technicians really take a lot of pride in their work and it shows. This product has about half inch insulation rigid backing that makes it more solid. Looks like actual wood when driving up to the house. It matches other wooden board and batten we have on front of our house. I was tired of painting and replacing weather worn boards. We ordered color that matches the paint we have on the house. No more on ladder for me on this particular wall of the house. Once again i do recommend Isbell. Really nice technicians that do a great job. As other time price i believe was real reasonable.

You do not give me enough stars.  How about 6 or 7 of them?  I have been through roof installation and repairs to that installation for several years and thousands of dollars.
Pickett Construction LLC was recommended to me by a home inspector (I am a real estate agent).   I ordered a brand new metal roof.  They have covered me up with service.    They do what they say they will do WHEN they say they will do it!  Such competent installers.  Each one is an expert.  The company stands behind its work and it is all guaranteed.  Take this from me:  Do it right the first time.  Use Pickett Construction and look no further.

name: Jammie Eldridge
text: This business is a great one especially making ur home look beautiful & it has homes u can buy or rent. The owner is a really good person he also makes sure it's exactly the way u want it

name: Michael Daniel
text:
8 years ago we hired Pickett Construction to install a new roof, gutters and downspouts, and vinyl siding on our home. The quality of workmanship was outstanding, and the work was completed in  only 5 days. My wife and I could not have been happier.

Then last month after a rain shower, we noticed water stains on the ceiling in two different rooms. Because Pickett installed the roof 8 years ago, we called them about the problem. Josh sent his roofer to our home to see if a cause for the water leak(s) could be found, because from the outside the roofing shingles were not damaged or missing and looked fine. However after a few minutes looking in the attic and walking the roof, it was determined that during construction of my home some 25 years ago, a handful of framing nails used to secure the plywood roof deck had missed the rafter below, and after all these years had begun to back out of the plywood deck, pushing up the roof shingle just enough to let water pass underneath. The roofer walked the entire roof looking for nails that were backing out (not just in the area of the water stains below, but the whole roof), removing all that he found, sealing the hole and making sure the roof shingle lay flat. Two days after the repairs we had a lot of rain, and no water leaks inside the house.

Once again, Pickett Construction has made my wife and I very happy, and I will not hesitate to call them in the future. It's nice to know that the quality of workmanship and professionalism we knew 8 years ago is still present today.

name: tb harvey
text: Hired these people to do light repairs and painting.  Took 3 weeks to complete the painting.  They did poor preparation work on several parts of the house.  They did not paint the rear door to my detached garage,though they painted the trim.  They bent the gutter on my garage and was balking at replacing it until I showed some video.  They did not remount one of my porch lights, nor did they reattach a lens to one of the driveway flood lights. They left trash in the yard and on the front porch and in the plants behind the house. They missed painting trim on one of the back doors.  They replaced a French door that was alarmed. They had to detach the alarm panel from the wall because the new door trim was slightly larger.  After they finished the alarm would not work nor did they remount the alarm panel...just left it hanging by the wires.  When I questioned them the reply was “we don’t do that kind of work.”  Overall the work was substandard and the post work cleanup nearly nonexistent. Cannot recommend these folks . I have pictures if you need to see.

resp.text: We are sorry you had a bad experience.  We don't ask for final balance until you are completely satisfied. Thanks for your input.

name: Linda Ackley
text: Over the years Pickett Construction has re-roofed our home, installed new windows, and re-modeled our bathroom vanity, and kitchen.  We were pleased with all the results.  That is not to say that everything always went smoothly or on time, but that seems to be the norm for the construction business in general.  However, as promised by the Better Business Bureau of which Pickett is a member, they will resolve any problems to the customer's satisfaction and did.  Pickett also re-roofed our daughter's house to her satisfaction.

name: Amelia Cothran
text: I hired Pickett Construction to replace all of the floors in my house. The workers did an excellent job. Everyone was prompt and professional, from Josh in the office to the guys who installed the tile.I appreciated the courtesy with which the workers treated me and my children. I would definitely use Pickett Construction again.

name: Peaches H
text:
Pickett Construction replaced my roof and gutters a few years ago. They did such a good job that I called them when I was ready to replace the siding on my house. It turned out beautifully!
Alas, it had barely been done 4 months when another company dropped a ladder against it hard enough to seriously damage it. That company denied culpability. Nice,huh? I contacted Josh Pickett and he made a few calls and found that they had some siding in my style and color already in stock so I wouldn't have to shell out $300 for another box of siding. He then called his installers to see how much they would charge to swap out the few pieces of damaged siding. Mind you, this is four days before Christmas. Then I got an email saying it had all been fixed and when I asked how much my final bill was I was told "no charge"! Now that is the kind of company I will keep calling when I need repairs done. They bend over backwards to make sure they do the job right and that their customers are happy long term. I am looking forward to my next home improvement project with Pickett Construction.

text: Very Reputable, considerate and helpful.  Quality workmanship.  My roof was done in really cold weather and they finished it in record time but they took care of all the problems that was damaged by hail damage.  I would highly recommend this Construction firm for all your Restoration or building needs.  Top Notched.

name: Tami Pickett
text: Professional services for home remodel or new custom built homes.  Customer service is always on point... Licensed, insured and bonded!  They will work with you to make your vision become a reality!

name: Bud Pommer
text:
I've had three experiences with Pickett Construction. All of them great. First; in the process of selling my home an inspection revealed hail damage on the roof and the determination that the tiles had to be replaced. Called Pickett. They gave an estimate (which ended up being lower than insurance company was going to pay). I signed contract and they showed up when they said they would, completed the work when they said they would, job looked great, did a good job cleaning up and all this done in a respectful and empathetic fashion to meet my need of completion of job prior to closing date on house.
I've moved to the Gulf Coast but still have rental property in Jefferson County.  Insurance company review dictated the need of handrails for front steps. I had one month to get then installed or they would drop my coverage on the house. The Rental Management Company for that property got some quotes but I called Pickett Construction on my own. I gave them the contract knowing I would get quality work done on time. What I really gave them besides the contract was my trust. That's something that's hard to do these days. Again, they didn't let me down!
My third experience with them was to get a quote on electrical work at that rental property. They looked at the job, told me what needed to be done but couldn't do it do it because they were covered up at the time. So, they referred me to an electrician who was half the price of other quotes and also did a great job.
I highly recommend Pickett Construction.

We contacted them, got an estimate, and within a week we had a brand new roof.  It looks great; the price was fair; and our insurance company was pleased to work with Pickett.  They knew Mr. Pickett by reputation!  Oh, I can't forget how thorough the actual roofing crew was when it came to cleaning up. The only thing different after they left was our beautiful new roof. I can't wait till we have the funds to set Picket Construction loose on our siding and deck and bathrooms....well, you get the picture! I trust them to do the job right whatever it is.

name: Kurt DeAngelis
text:
We decided to do a major renovation on our 30 year old split foyer in Alabaster. I had a huge wish list that far exceeded the funds I had available and had to prioritize needs, essentilas and desirables. Josh assisted me in mximizing the budget with a detailed proposal that enabled me to do this. Josh did a great job with my wife letting her see and select the tile, flooring and paint, etc.

Do you want to know if Pickett is versatile or can get the job done fast? Pickett did the following items in 17 days ... 350 feet of new privacy fence and gates, paint entire house exterior, re-roof covered deck, remove turbines and patch roof areas, repair rotted roof decking around chimney stack, re-flashed and re-roofed the area, installed new LED motion detecting security lights, installed new outdoor lighting over front door,replaced all windows with new double hung, double pane vinyl windows, installed new laminate/engineered word floors on the entire main level of the house, laid tile in both foyers, kitchen and den/study, replaced every interior door and all hardware, installed new ceiling fans in each bedroom and main foyer, removed wrought iron raining in foyer and replaced with wood and balusters, primed and painted all interior trim, scraped popcorn/acoustic ceiling from kitchen, repaired drywall issues in bedrooms and kitchen, textured and painted kitchen walls.

Any "extra" I asked about was repsonded with a written proposal so that there could be no confusion or disaggrement.

To get these things done in the time frame of 17 days ... including holidays ... shows excellent planning and execution. I was kept informed as to what was scheduled for the day, who would be there and what to expect. They arranged for the construction dumpster delivery and pick up. Pickett did a nice job on the site clean up as well.

Punch list items were few and far between and resolved promptly.

The only thing that would be close to a concern or a negative was the sub-contracting tile guy who was going through a diviorce while he did the job. He did not do a bad job but his distraction resulted in a couple of small punch list things that Josh had Tripp take care of. I was assured that they would not be using this tile guy in the future.

Would I recommend Pickett Construction to you? Absolutely. Want to see pics of the renovation? I have them. Will I use them again in the future? Absolutely. As a matter of fact, my daughter used them on a foreclosure she purchased in Calera. She got prompt thorough quality work done as well.

name: Tim Calhoun
text:
Pricing:
We contracted with Pickett to complete some work on our house to prepare it for sale. We were looking for some typical wood rot to be replaced and exterior paint. We also requested an interior paint quote. I think the quote was a bit high for the exterior work, but not so bad that I didn't go with their services. The quote for the interior painting was outrageous, so we opted for another painter. The other painter's quote was nearly $3000 less than the quote from Pickett. We were also having some plywood put in the ceiling of the carport, because the builder used interior drywall in our neighborhood. Pickett gave us a "complimentary upgrade" to beadboard instead of plain plywood. This really added a nice touch to the carport ceiling, and was an appreciated upgrade. They only requested 1/2-down to start the work, which we felt was certainly reasonable. They also honored their coupon they regularly have (often in the Alabaster Newsletter, or ValPack). We printed ours from the ValPack website.

Workmanship:
The quality of the exterior work was pretty good. There were a few spots where the painting got a bit "sloppy," but was overall good work. The beadboard in the carport made a great upgrade to our carport, and added a touch of "class" to an otherwise mundane area of the house. Unfortunately, due to our unusually cold winter, the holidays, and several bouts with rain, our work was regularly delayed. It took a bit longer than expected to complete, but didn't delay our schedule of listing the house. The little interaction I had with the crew was polite and courteous, though at times the project manager came across as mildly arrogant. Communicating with the PM via email was the best medium, although he sometimes took a bit longer than expected to return messages.

Post Work Follow-up:
Again, the delays in returning messages made for a challenge in clearing our post-work "punch list," but this was also around the holidays, so we conceded a bit.  Had there been more clear communication about workday expectations (e.g. workers will/will not be onsite today) this would have made for better overall feeling about the length of the job.
During our home buyer's inspection, they found more wood rot that was inadvertently overlooked by the crew. While I don't expect the painters to look over every square inch of the house (heck, neither did I!), it ended up being a significant portion of the chimney that had rotted out the edge of our masonite siding. One would expect that at least part of that might have been discovered and either repaired or at least alerted me to the potential change in an estimate so it could be repaired. When we approached our PM about correcting it, he gave us a price quote. After paying over $6000 for the original work, this was certainly unexpected, especially with their "1 year warranty." I spoke with Josh, the owner's son who is also in management with the company. He immediately started working with me to find a reasonable solution. I ended up having to pay a bit more, but we did come to an acceptable compromise on the final cost of the supplemental work. In the end, Josh personally stopped by the house to deliver the revised agreement and took pictures of the missed work. It turned out that the rot was more severe than even he expected. He opted to continue to honor that revised estimate and didn't charge anymore. Josh really worked hard to make a relatively displeasing situation wok out well in the end. Josh was absolutely committed to service and ensuring my end satisfaction. He even reached out after the supplemental work was completed to check in on my satisfaction, and knowing there was a bit of a sour taste, still wanted this Google Review. Josh knows what it takes to listen to customer concerns and immediately find a reasonable solution that works in the best interest of all parties. Had it not been for Josh's actions, my 4-star rating would have been a high 2-star, or low 3-star.

name: DH Test1
text:
I would like to commend the Superior Roofing team for effective project coordination and excellent craftsmanship while working under this summer’s high heat index weather conditions.  The Superior Roofing team replaced the shingles on our steep, tree-damaged roof, removed damaged gutters, installed new gutters with a perfect color match to our existing fascia trim, and expertly repaired our tree-damaged deck railings and steps.  We are very pleased with the results of all this multi-trade work and have received quite a few neighborhood compliments on the results.
A late spring storm with heavy rains and high winds had caused a huge, old poplar tree to fall on our house.  Once our insurance company had completed their initial estimate of repairing the damage, we made our list of potential service providers and included Superior Roofing.  The estimator returned our call promptly and set up a convenient appointment to come by our house to assess our situation.  After walking the site, he explained his estimate while talking around the kitchen table with us and provided a professional package of insurance and business license documentation.  We had previously talked with several other very reputable and capable companies, but only a few could manage all the tasks in a single installation window and even fewer were willing to stay within our preferred guidelines for deck repair rather than replacement.  The Superior Roofing estimator described how the team could do our preferred repairs and created a window of opportunity in the work schedule.  After weighing a lot of factors, we decided to do business with Superior Roofing based on the estimator’s straight-forward and professional manner, experience working with insurance claims, personal referrals from other trusted service providers we had used, the company’s excellent ratings on several web sites and with the Better Business Bureau (A+ rating), and the interesting completed projects described on the company’s web site.  The estimator personally showed up on site while the work was being done, made sure we were satisfied with the work, and followed up promptly with the close-out paperwork and insurance coordination.  As with so many home repair projects, some field changes to work already quoted were requested by us or suggested by the project lead on site.  The estimator and the project lead communicated promptly with us, gave us their candid assessments, provided cost deltas both plus and minus, and decisions that worked for all parties were made without delaying the work schedule.  Thank you, Superior Roofing - we enjoyed working with you and we appreciate the excellent results your team produced for us.

resp.text:
A mistake was made by a new estimator when the original estimate was given.  Management reviewed the estimate before installing the roof and found the total number of squares to be installed inadequate. As a result, we revised the estimate to the correct square count and adjusted the price accordingly.  The homeowner was given the option to continue at the new adjusted price. He declined saying that we should install the roof at the original contract price, even though the mistake was discovered prior to any work being done. As a result of our company not being able to be underpaid $1300.00 by this customer, he wrote a bad review even though we did no work for him whatsoever.
We make every effort to be accurate in our estimating. However, if a mistake is made we have a system to detect that miscalculation prior to work being performed.

We did have one issue with a pane that the seal failed on.  That's a real test of the warranty, and I was very pleased with how easy it was to get it corrected.  Small issues happen, what really counts is how they're handled.  Window World of Dothan made the process of get it replaced so easy-one quick email and it was done.

Kudos to the entire team at Window World of Dothan.  You folks are great, and I have no problem recommending you.

name: C. Gatlin
text:
If I could give Window World of Dothan, AL a -100, I would.  I would NEVER refer them to anyone nor EVER use them again.  They are the absolute worst in customer service.  The salesperson is the face of the company and that’s about as good as it gets.   It is difficult to contact them by phone and when you do no one is ever around who has any answers.  The receptionist or answering service must always get back to you, and usually never the same day.  I don’t know the criteria for Window World being ranked as the #1 replacement company in America, but it can’t be based on any contributions from Window World of Dothan, AL, at least not for doors and shutters.

We contracted with Window World of Dothan, AL on 1 Oct 2019 for 10 sets of outdoor shutters and a front door.  The install should have only taken a day. The install began on 16 Nov in the late afternoon and still has not been completed as of today, 9 Jan 2020.  The individual sent to install the shutters and door obviously didn’t care about the job because the quality of the installs were substandard.  We tried to give him space and let him do his job, but that was a mistake because when we looked closer at the tall shutters they were installed with only 4 pegs instead of 6 (industry standard) and did not place the pegs uniformly (symmetrically) into the mortar, some directly into the brick.  When asked if 4 pegs was a Window World standard, he said it didn't matter.  We also asked if he filled the old holes and he stated "some",  which we knew meant "none". His defense was to say there were lots of holes in our house.

The installer completed the haphazard shutter install and departed because it started to drizzle and he didn't want the caulking to get wet. He was supposed to return the next day (Friday) to install the door.  He sent a text on Friday to say he was still on a job in GA and wouldn't arrive until the afternoon. We responded that we didn't like afternoon appointments because he would be rushing the door install the same way he rushed the shutter install and make more mistakes.  He agreed to return the following day in the morning.  Meanwhile, my wife attempted to call Window World, Dothan several times to ask about the standards for shutter installation but no one ever called her back.

As he was installing the door on Saturday, we let him know the door was not square in the frame.  His ongoing response was to tell us that our house was the reason the door wasn't straight. Once the install was complete we continued to let him know we were not satisfied with the way the door looked in the frame.  As he prepared to install the storm door, he realized the frame had to be shimmed and stated he would return on Sunday to finish the job.  When he returned at 9am we told him that the thresh hold needed to be adjusted more because we could see car lights under the door and feel the cold air. He appeared a little agitated. He became more agitated when my wife asked "hypothetically" what would happen if we wanted to discuss the possibility of getting another door. He then said he could fix the door.  My wife asked him if that was the case why he hadn't fixed it in the first place.  He proceeded to tell my wife that she complained about the shutters and every little thing about the door. He then stopped what he was doing and left the storm door uninstalled.  He told her that day was his last day at Window World so he didn't care if we complained.

My wife called Window World the following Monday  and asked to speak to the owner.  Instead of being contacted by the owner, the salesman was sent for damage control.  He stated he would have the shutters reordered and expedited.  Another installer was sent to correct the door install.  He made some additional adjustments that helped but was still not the quality of install we expected.  It is currently 9 Jan 2020 and we have not heard from Window World about the shutters or the fact that we are extremely DISSATISFIED customers.  Their lack of care, concern, and communication speaks volumes about the organization.

resp.text: Mr. Gatlin, we appreciate the time spent sharing this information with us. There are several items mentioned in your comments that we are not clear on from our previous communications with you. We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss in more detail, as well as give you an update on the shutters we reordered for you. Management will reach out to you promptly to discuss. Regards.

name: Jason Horvath
text:
Salesman Kevin was very knowledgeable and convincing that Champion Windows is the best option and we would have no issues so  I cancelled my appointment with a competitor for the next day. Kevin mentioned it would take 6-8 weeks (possibly as little as 3 weeks) but there was absolutely NO communication from Champion the whole 8 weeks. On week #6 half the bill was charged with interest with NO work being completed and no communication on when it would be completed/started. When this was addressed with Charlie (owner) it was ignored and not resolved. There was no mention of us being charged BEFORE work was completed. We called the Champion local office twice with no response. On the 3rd time we called corporate and Damon (installation manager) quickly returned my call.
The installation guys were 40 minutes late from appointment time, again with NO communication. I had to call to find out they needed to stop and get caulk on the way to my house. I would think they would have been prepared with the proper equipment prior to the customer's appointment time.
The installers were polite and professional, however I brought up some quality issues during the installation process that did not get properly taken care of until they said they were leaving causing them to stay longer and redo some of their work. (Gap in the J-molding, they wanted to caulk the gap, not fix it) Corporate called me wanted me to sign a form stating the job was done even though the installers were still here finishing the job.  When I mentioned the issues regarding some other problems (window & screen defects) Damon called me to come out to resolve the issues.
Bottom Line: Customer service and apologies goes a long way. I feel that I had reach out and try to communicate to get the work done that costs thousands of dollars. As a customer, I should not have to work as hard as I did to get the job done properly which is still in progress.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Jason. We use this feedback to make sure our services are nothing less than the best for all our customers. We are sorry to hear that you had a poor experience with us. If you would like to reach out to us in national customer care to speak further, please call us at 513-327-7338. Thank you.

text:
5 Stars -They did a great job in 2017 when they installed my sunroom.

I have spoken to a few people that have given me nothing but a runaround. Several promised they would work out my issue and follow it through to a satisfactory conclusion. Nothing happening so far and based on recent past experience, I'm not holding my breath.
All I am trying to do is get a pet door that fits the wall in may 3 season room. I'm willing to consider buying it out right or having them install it. Can't even get anyone to talk to me about it.

name: Judy Shockey
text: I have lived in a home with Champion Windows before, and I really enjoyed their performance and ease of use. So when I bought another home that needed window replacements, I naturally decided to go with Champion Windows. They were installed just prior to a hard freeze, and suddenly I had no more drafts. The installation was very professional as well, and I was impressed with how many times the windows were measured to insure that the replacements would really fit properly. I'm very pleased with the appearance of the windows inside and out, and I look forward to lower heating and cooling bills, based on my previous experience with them. name: Cat Taps
text:
We contacted the toll-free number for Champion Windows (please know: this # is not your local Champion dealer but just a service...I hope!) for 6 months!  We just wanted a person to come by and talk to us about a new sunroom. This phone system service (meaning=the "trained" people manning the phones) is highly disorganized! Perhaps it is because of the virus? Leaving messages or even setting up appointments to meet with a representative and that representative never showed is very disheartening. (0 stars for that set-up-an-appt craziness.) Corporate office? You need to get that fixed! Perhaps employ another phone service to answer your toll calls? 🤔

FINALLY...after months of calls...we got our Champion reps at our home.

Matt and Charles came to us in East Limestone from the Huntsville office which is by the airport. Having already had sales presentations by two competitors, we knew what to expect in their presentation. They immediately realized we were most interested in quality and price for our new sunroom.

Matt was thorough in showing us the construction of their unique products. He even had samples to demonstrate the sunroom's best attributes.

We were surprised at the price. Matt was precise and clear on it. One contract, too, one price. Never additional hidden fees. Perhaps we contacted them at the correct time since it is December after all. 😁 Good price for the quality...the sunroom we chose actually can be added to our home square footage.

Charles invited us to come by their showroom. I suggest everyone do this! Seeing several sunrooms already set up truly helps in your decision process versus just seeing magazine quality sunrooms in their catalogs.

Charles even brought us to the back of where products are custom made for every sunroom. These are not kits. We went for the 6in depth walls. Seeing the sun rooms in the office and showroom also convinced us to go ahead with additional products. Charles was not pushy at all. We made these decisions on our own.

Both Matt & Charles also gave us their personal cell phone numbers and we have called them several times. They have always been available -immediately-. We appreciate this courtesy! (Those 5 ⭐'s for them.)

Having read 1-🌟 reviews from a year ago...yikes! We decided to see for ourselves and really tested our sales team. We also detected this Huntsville office was working to improve themselves. So far? We are off to a good start. We are waiting for construction people to come and measurable are sunroom. Hope to bring you up-to-date after this happens.

text:
The other Google reviews they have are accurate! We worked with Matt Jackson to get a quote, but he kept changing pricing every time we asked him to calculate it for us. He lied to tell us about what the windows would look like, and told us the installers were all Champion employees - which they are not. Their sub-contractors repeatedly left our house completely open to the elements for hours and even days at a time which led to many issues for which Champion refused to accept responsibility. We spoke to Corey, the install manager, Rob McCauley, the regional manager, and even a national customer service manager - all who insisted the issues we experienced were not Champion's fault. Corey's temper when we involved Rob in communicating our concerns was completely unprofessional. Rob offered to give us a gift card for dinner as a compensation for the trouble we experienced (what a joke!). The national customer service manager threatened me and swore at me when I insisted Champion make the right the issues we experienced.

This company is full of dishonest, unprofessional, and unexperienced people charging high prices for a product of average quality.

UPDATE IN RESPONSE TO CHAMPION'S RESPONSE: If nothing else, please take Champion's sarcastic response to my feedback as a token of their lack of professionalism. You can see from the reviews of others that our experience is not an outlier, but rather the norm for how Champion operates. Of course we noted our windows had just been replaced - WE SPENT OVER $12,000.00 ON THEM.

CHAMPION WILL LIE TO YOU, SEND SUB-PAR CONTRACTORS TO INSTALL THEIR AVERAGE-QUALITY WINDOWS, AND THEN STEAL YOUR MONEY AND DO EVERYTHING THEY CAN TO MAINTAIN THEIR FACADE TO TRAP OTHERS - DO NOT FALL FOR IT!

name: Steve Palmer
text: Excellent Product, Install and Service! This is a good long read. We have a home that has 32 windows. These windows were from the original build back in 1999. Over time these windows failed, broke internal components, were loose, didn't stay up and let so much air in between them; it really hurt our HVAC bills. We decided to look at new windows. We went through the hoops and ringers with various window companies in the area and the big box stores. The price ranges were all over the place and the functions, options, features and price points were the driving factors in this big home reno purchase. We called Champion (CW going forward) and had our salesman Whit come out and give his sales pitch. He did a great pitch and was at our house for 4 plus hours. Going over every detail and question we had. He was not afraid to say "I don't know, but I will find out" and called ahead to ask with us on his speakerphone right in front of him. He never stepped out to his truck to ask; he just did it right in front of us. We wanted an answer and he went and got one. Good bad or indifferent there was no empty promises or sugar coated answers. We were explained all the finance options and the promo they were having during our consultation. We beat him up pretty good with our wants and needs for the windows. After that was done, Cory then came out a few days later and walked me through the measurement process; again answering my rhetorical questions and others I missed with Whit. He took meticulous measurements of ALL my windows and explained what my casements would be and how they would sit in the frame. I walked through the house with and he asked questions to me about each room as he measured and took detailed notes. We discussed the order that was first taken to verify everything was right...the first time. He explained the install and what was done with that process from top to bottom. As well as what to expect with financing options again. Making this as streamlined as possible. He explained our order, what timeline for delivery was and the timeline of the install process once the windows arrived from the factory. Once our windows arrived in Huntsville, we were given a few choices on the install. We picked the date that worked on our schedule and a timeframe that made sense for the install. Once again, were explained the who what when were and how on the install team. The install team was on time the first day with everything ready and planned out so they could hit the ground running. Jimmy Mashburn and Brandon Clark were the install team and they were incredible. I have OCD about fit and finish and so does this install team. Jimmy talked with my wife so she would get the understanding of the install and what she could expect. He didn't make her feel silly for asking and was very professional with each question. We, of course stayed out of the way, but if either side had a question about a window, my wife and or Jimmy/Brandon made sure both parties were on the same page. They took their time and set everything right the first time. We didn't care how long it took and they were very meticulous and detail driven on each window. They were not in any hurry to just set 'em and forget 'em. It was done right the first time. I'm no installer but I'm a homeowner that bought 32 windows so I was wanting to find something wrong or find a shortcut that I saw...NOPE! I couldn't find anything that I felt was incorrect or not done in a make sense manner. Everything was top notch work. All my old windows were removed and stacked out of the way. Drop cloths were placed inside on each opening to make sure the removal was as clean and clutter free. All of the windows were set correctly, openings were cleaned from past dirt and debris. Professional 100%!! I felt that my money was going to the right company for our home. These are big decisions to make when getting new windows and the value of the CW product met our families need. We are truly very happy with our windows and would recommend CW to anyone!! We are very happy we went with Champion!

name: Susan Goodson
text: We met this company at a home show in Huntsville.  At that time, we were in the process of selling our home and from the feedback we received, folks were wanting lighter cabinets which is why we spoke to them.   Fast forward a few months.  I rec'd a call from the company following up from our contact.  I scheduled an appt. but told the caller we have since moved but the home we own now was in need of a kitchen re-model.  The appt. came and went and no one showed.  Come to find out, rep went to our old address ( I gave new address during the phone call)  I called them to reschedule.  Rep showed up at our home and that was the end of the beginning.  He did not listen to us.  We did no want re-facing but he continued to measure existing cabinets which we did no intend to keep.  I asked to look at the books he brought in.  He asked rather snarkily, have you checked out our website???  Yes, but since you have books can I look?  At the  end of a very awkward meeting, he said they have a designer that could help with what we want.  We have not heard anything from this company 4 months later.  The end.  Would not recommend this company.

name: J H
text: This company installed gutters on our new house, and we were happy at first.  We even gave them a really good review on Angie's list.  Later we started having the rain spill over some of the gutters and some looked bowed out from the house.  They came out and repaired one spot, but we continued to have problems.  They said they would come back, but they never did.  The owner said that they had gotten a batch of bad nails.  Shouldn't they have put in new nails when they discovered they had used a bad batch on our house?  We also tried to use them on one of our company jobs; they didn't show up for the appointment.  They said they did.  They admitted they saw our work truck but didn't see us.  We were on the side of the house working while waiting for him to show up.  Not sure why he didn't get out of the truck and look.  He just left.  Finally, we did meet with them, and they did do the job.  But about 10 days later, our customer called and said the rain was coming over the top of the gutters.  My husband had told them it needed another downspout, but they said it didn't.  They never came out to check the gutters.  They said that if they  were stopped up that they would charge us for coming out.  If gutters stop up after only a few days, there's got to be a problem with the gutters. (not enough slope for the rain to run out, not enough downspouts to handle the amount of rain, etc...)  There are no leaves falling in early summer so what can stop them up?  While talking to my husband on the phone, the owner even said my husband acted like a D---.  Now how professional is that?  I guess no one has the right to get frustrated when someone doesn't do their job.  We will never call them again.
